intro: Pilosella pseudosparsa, commonly known as the slender pearly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are surrounded by pale green bracts, giving it a pearly appearance. Pilosella pseudosparsa typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats and is often found in open, sunny areas. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
